description:
The configuration option xenapi_connection_url should only be used by nova-compute to connect to its hypervisor. It should not be exposed during the migration. A xapi call could be made to detect the real management IP of the hypervisor.

This would enable the use of local connections
title: xenapi: xenapi_connection_url should not be used externally

comments.content:
The configuration option xenapi_connection_url should only be used by cpu to connect to its hypervisor. It should not be exposed during the migration. A xapi call could be made to detect the real management IP of the hypervisor.

This would enable the use of local connections
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mate-lakat

comments.content:
Simple xe calls to get the real IP:

MGT_NETWORK=`xe pif-list management=true params=network-uuid minimal=true`
MGT_BRIDGE_OR_NET_NAME=`xe network-list uuid=$MGT_NETWORK params=bridge minimal=true`
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mate-lakat
https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mate-lakat

comments.content: Need to take care when there are multiple management networks present.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content: Can you please add what you mean by "used externally" and give examples of where it used, and what uses you are trying to remove?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content:
There can only be one "management network" - there is a single management PIF from which an address is identified.  XAPI does listen on all IPs in dom0, but only one of them is designated management.

The "used externally" is referring to the migration - we should use what XAPI knows is the management network and address, not what we specify as the XENAPI_CONNECTION_URL - which can be a local address since Nova is talking to XAPI over that address.
